intro: Jussiaea weddelii, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in harsh environments such as Antarctica and subantarctic islands. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in early spring when conditions are most favorable. Jussiaea weddelii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms in its extreme environment.
